questions.question: Which acupressure point is known for relieving nausea and morning sickness during pregnancy?
Where is the P6 (Nei Kuan) point located?
choices: On the sole of the foot
On the inner forearm, about three finger-widths below the wrist crease
Midway between neck and top of shoulder
In the webbing between thumb and index finger
questions.answer: On the inner forearm, about three finger-widths below the wrist crease

questions.question: Which point should be avoided during pregnancy except during labor, as it can induce contractions?
What is the primary benefit of stimulating the GB21 (Jian Jing) point during pregnancy?
choices: Alleviates back pain and neck tension
questions.answer: Alleviates back pain and neck tension

questions.question: Where is the SP6 (San Yin Jiao) point located?
choices: On the inner leg, four finger-widths above inner ankle bone
On the sole of the foot
On the back of the hand
questions.answer: On the inner leg, four finger-widths above inner ankle bone

questions.question: What is the main benefit of stimulating the KD1 (Yong Quan) point during pregnancy?
Which of the following is a key safety consideration when practicing acupressure during pregnancy?
choices: Use gentle pressure and avoid deep tissue massage
Stimulate LI4 and SP6 points frequently
questions.answer: Use gentle pressure and avoid deep tissue massage

questions.question: In Traditional Chinese Medicine, what is believed to flow through meridians in the body?
Which acupressure point is located in the webbing between the thumb and index finger?
What is the recommended duration for applying pressure to the P6 point for nausea relief?
Which acupressure point is beneficial for reducing fatigue and edema during pregnancy?
What is the primary caution associated with the GB21 (Jian Jing) point during pregnancy?
choices: It can induce labor if deep pressure is applied
It should never be used during pregnancy
questions.answer: It can induce labor if deep pressure is applied

questions.question: Which acupressure point is located on the sole of the foot?
What is the recommended technique for stimulating the GB21 point?
In which situation should acupressure be avoided during pregnancy?
What is the primary benefit of acupressure during pregnancy?
choices: It replaces the need for prenatal vitamins
It provides a non-invasive, drug-free method to alleviate common discomforts
It ensures a perfect pregnancy with no complications
questions.answer: It provides a non-invasive, drug-free method to alleviate common discomforts

questions.question: How should acupressure be integrated into prenatal care?
choices: As a complete replacement for medical care
In conjunction with regular prenatal care
Only if prescribed by a doctor
questions.answer: In conjunction with regular prenatal care

questions.question: What is the recommended position for practicing acupressure during pregnancy?
Which of the following is NOT a common benefit of acupressure during pregnancy?
choices: Guaranteed prevention of all pregnancy complications
questions.answer: Guaranteed prevention of all pregnancy complications

questions.question: What should a pregnant woman do if she experiences discomfort during acupressure?
Which acupressure point is known for its general pain-relieving properties?
What is the recommended frequency for practicing acupressure during pregnancy?
Which of the following is a contraindication for acupressure during pregnancy?
What is the primary purpose of using acupressure points during pregnancy?
choices: To promote balance and relieve symptoms
questions.answer: To promote balance and relieve symptoms

questions.question: Which acupressure point is associated with improving sleep quality during pregnancy?
What is the recommended approach when introducing acupressure to pregnant women in Timor-Leste?
choices: Replace all traditional methods with acupressure
Integrate acupressure with existing healthcare practices
Only teach it to medical professionals
questions.answer: Integrate acupressure with existing healthcare practices

questions.question: Which of the following is an important consideration when creating educational materials about acupressure for pregnant women in Timor-Leste?
choices: Create materials in Tetum with simple illustrations
questions.answer: Create materials in Tetum with simple illustrations

questions.question: What is the role of traditional birth attendants in the context of introducing acupressure in Timor-Leste?
choices: They should be excluded from the process
They should be replaced by acupressure practitioners
Collaboration and knowledge sharing should be encouraged
They should only observe but not participate
questions.answer: Collaboration and knowledge sharing should be encouraged

questions.question: How should acupressure techniques be practiced during the training course?
What is an important aspect to consider when gaining acceptance for acupressure in Timor-Leste communities?
choices: Imposing acupressure as the only valid method
Understanding and respecting cultural beliefs about pregnancy and childbirth
Avoiding any interaction with local healers
questions.answer: Understanding and respecting cultural beliefs about pregnancy and childbirth
